alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 09 at 1:34PM MST until January 10 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...West to southwest winds 35 to 50 MPH with gusts up to 70 MPH expected. Areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins. * WHEN...Until 2 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Areas of blowing and drifting snow may result in localized areas of significantly reduced visibilities at times, along with slick road conditions.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
